meanings.definition: A person who talks in a meaningless or nonsensical way about psychological or emotional issues.
meanings.sent1: The psychobabblers at the party kept going on about their dreams and feelings without making any sense.
meanings.sent2: The online forum was filled with psychobabblers sharing their unhelpful thoughts on therapy.
meanings.sent3: The psychobabblers in the movie were portrayed as comical characters who confused everyone with their jumbled words.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a playground for psychobabblers, each thought swinging wildly without direction.
meanings.sent5: The image of psychobabblers chattering away like monkeys in her head made her giggle.

meanings.definition: Plural noun: individuals who engage in superficial or overly simplistic discussions about mental health.
meanings.sent1: We avoided the psychobabblers in our class who only scratched the surface of mental health topics.
meanings.sent2: The psychobabblers in the meeting had no real understanding of the complexities of mental well-being.
meanings.sent3: The group of psychobabblers at the cafe argued loudly about mental health, but their words had no depth.
meanings.sent4: Their conversation was a sea of psychobabblers, each wave of words crashing without any real impact.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with the buzz of psychobabblers, their voices blending into a meaningless hum.
